intro: Ranunculus japonicus var. latissimus, commonly known as the broadleaf Japanese buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to East Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with multiple stems bearing numerous flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its botanical characteristics include a short rhizomatous root system and showy, cup-shaped blooms with five to eight petals.
